messageBody:
Google Parameterised Testcase

Its does what you want....

Andrew
PS: Out of interest, do the values really need to come from a file? or can
they be just hardcoded.




"Kunal Ashar" <kunal_ashar@...>
Sent by: junit@yahoogroups.com
10-Oct-2006 13:59
Please respond to junit@yahoogroups.com


To
junit@yahoogroups.com
cc

Subject
[junit] How to write a single test case with a sequence of multiple,
varying input?






I'm trying to author a JUnit-based test scenario where the input to a
single test case is a file name. However, the test case needs to
recursively run against, say, the names of all the files in a folder
and its subfolders.

Each file is a different test case, but the number, type and content
of files during each run will differ.

I don't want to pass all the files into my testXXX method in one shot
because that would mean the following:
- Semantically, it would be the equivalent of a single test case, not
multiple, and
- The test case would abort the moment it failed on a single file
instead of running through all the files (like I want it to)

I haven't seen this addressed anywhere. How do I achieve this? What is
the best/recommended way to write/execute a single JUnit test case
with a sequence of multiple, varying inputs?




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
